title: What's the fastest way to clean up a bad attitude? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ashish has the talent for understatement. “Easier” when you are not alone is to self-help in isolation like day is to the night. If your closest social circles actively oppose your life change, your chances decrease rapidly. If you have a social support for your change, your chances rise disproportionally high. Spend time with people you want to be like. This is the fastest way. The Ultra Shortcut Dr. Dunbar, an English anthropologist, discovered that humans include only about 250 people into their internal circle. He supposed that that was an average number of the tribe members in prehistoric times. But he was most blown away by accidental discovery – we can allow into our internal circles even superficial entities like brands. The more so, we can allow into this internal social circle real people who we know only through books, videos and audio. The man who had the most influence in the early stage of my life transformation was Jim Rohn. I discovered him three years after his death, but I consumed hundreds of hours of his videos and audio programs. He became my virtual mentor. He was the main reason I didn’t give up. You can do the same – follow someone online and consume their materials to the point when they become “real” to you, a part of your internal “tribe.” Solitary Discipline Spend time with people who have good attitude. And here goes a suplementary activity to do when you are alone… In December 2015 I listened to a podcast episode with Shawn Achor, the author of "The Happiness Advantage." It was eye-opening. It always puzzled me how much I was able to change in a few years. Shawn explained it. It all spawned from my gratitude journaling habit. “Gratitude rewires brain into positivity. When the brain is positive every possible outcome we know how to test for raises dramatically.” – Shawn Achor In this podcast episode, he tells about an astounding experiment. A 4-year kid with a pessimism gene was being asked for one month each morning about three new things he was grateful for. It made him a hardcore optimist for the rest of his life. Wow! Now brace yourself, they did the same with an 84 year old guy who had the same gene. The same thing happened. Gratitude is a powerful force. Practicing it just a few minutes a day can rewire your brain.  (gratitude entries in my journal) Every morning write three new things you are grateful for. 30 days and your attitude will get better. Guaranteed. If you need a detailed instruction, here is one: How a One-minute Action Changed My Life Completely

It's easier when you're not self-improving alone, so for inspiration and encouragement find role models you want to emulate. And these don't have to be in real life follow go-getter entrepreneurs , follow happiness-seekers on , or read the encouraging posts of a self-development blogger. Surround yourself with positive role models and their vibes will start rubbing off on and teaching you. Instagram page- motivationaldiaries Youtube- Ashish Janiani
